intro: Monocera elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic monocera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are elliptical in shape, hence the species name, and are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Monocera elliptica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
